1.speaker: POLAR BEAR
1.japanese: あけまして おめでとうございます

2.speaker: ALL(BUT SLOTH)
2.japanese: あけまして おめでとうございます

3.speaker: SLOTH
3.japanese: あけまして おめでとうございます

4.speaker: POLAR BEAR
4.japanese: 今年も『しろくまカフェ』をよろしくお願いします
4.english: Please support Polar Bear's Café this year, too. Please support Polar Bear's Café this year, too.

5.speaker: SLOTH
5.japanese: 今年もよろしくお願いします

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.japanese: じゃあ 挨拶はこのぐらいにして
6.english: Well, now that we've got the greetings over with,

7.speaker: PENGUIN
7.english: how about we get things rolling for the new year?

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.japanese: 『しろくまカフェ』新年かくし芸大会
8.english: Polar Bear's Café's New Year's hidden talent competition!

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.japanese: 今年も いつものように
10.english: We will have everyone show off their hidden talents like we do every year.

11.speaker: GRIZZLY
11.english: Don't wake me up from my hibernation for something like this.

12.speaker: POLAR BEAR
12.japanese: たまにはいいじゃない
12.english: It doesn't hurt someti— It's {\i1}all{\i0} the time! Really?

13.speaker: POLAR BEAR
13.japanese: まぁまぁ お正月くらいみんなと一緒に過ごそうよ
13.english: Now, now. We should at least spend New Year's together.

14.speaker: GRIZZLY
14.japanese: まぁいいや 早く始めろよ

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: それでは トップバッターにふさわしい
15.english: And now, a delightful New Year's appropriate display...

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.japanese: 新年らしい華々しいかくし芸を披露してくれるのは…

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: 僕 ということでいいかな

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: お正月だしいいよと言うしかないかな
18.english: I don't think we have any other choice but to say yes, since it's New Year's. Well, let's start off with another slightly idiotic ta—

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: ちょっと 今始めたばかりなのに 何
20.english: Hey. I just started. What is it?

21.speaker: PANDA
21.japanese: ペンギンさんの落語いつもやってるやつでしょ
21.english: You're always doing your traditional comedic storytelling, right?

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: かくし芸じゃないよね
22.english: That wouldn't be a hidden talent, would it?

23.speaker: PANDA
23.japanese: もっと隠してるやつ見せてよ
23.english: Show us something more hidden. I guess I could show you a hidden one, but I practiced this quite a bit... Show us your hidden talent! Well, I guess I'll show you the one I want to keep hidden the most...

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.english: We have arrived. I think you should have kept that hidden.

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.japanese: だから そう言ったよ 僕は

26.speaker: PENGUIN
26.japanese: シロクマ君 僕が立ち直るまで進めて
26.english: Polar Bear, could you keep things rolling while I lick my wounds?

27.speaker: POLAR BEAR
27.japanese: うん じゃあ 次は誰

29.speaker: SASAKO
29.japanese: ナマケモノさん やる気ですね

30.speaker: SLOTH
30.english: Tablecloth pulling... Here I go... If I pull the tablecloth quickly... The glasses... will remain in place... That's quite a slow explanation... There... Time for a break... I think this may take a while. Here we go...

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.japanese: 予想どおりの結果だね
31.english: I think everyone was expecting that. Now we'll have... someone from who we don't know what to expect...

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: おもしろいことが始まりそうな気配ないけど
35.english: It doesn't seem like anything interesting will happen,

36.speaker: PENGUIN
36.japanese: 頑張って 半田さん
36.english: but do your best, Mr. Handa. Thanks.

37.speaker: HANDA
37.japanese: それではこのキャベツの芯をくりぬいて
37.english: First, we're going to remove the core of the cabbage. And then, if we place a wet paper towel in its place...

40.speaker: HANDA
40.english: Yes? That's not a hidden talent. That's like grandma's pearls of wisdom.

44.speaker: HANDA
44.japanese: あっ ロールキャベツを作るとき
44.english: Oh! I know of a way

45.speaker: HANDA
45.japanese: キャベツを破かないで剥がす方法もありますよ
45.english: to keep the leaves from tearing when making cabbage rolls!

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: 半田さん キャベツから離れよう
46.english: Let's stray away from cabbages, Mr. Handa.

47.speaker: POLAR BEAR
47.japanese: なんかあったかい気分になったね
47.english: I'm kinda getting that warm, fuzzy feeling on the inside. You're just trying to sound nice since it's New Year's, Polar Bear.

48.speaker: SASAKO
48.japanese: 半田さん キャベツの長持ちするのお店でやってみます
48.english: I'll give that trick to make cabbages last longer a try at the café, Mr. Handa.

50.speaker: PENGUIN
50.japanese: じゃあ そろそろパンダ君見せてよ
50.english: Let's see what you've got, Panda.

55.speaker: PANDA
55.japanese: それでは 二人羽織です
55.english: Now we will begin our helping hands act.

56.speaker: FT PANDA
56.japanese: よろしくお願いします
56.english: Please watch. There. There. There. There.

58.speaker: FT PANDA
58.japanese: パンダ君 ちょっと それ貸して
58.english: Panda, could you hand me that? Panda's not doing anything.

59.speaker: PENGUIN
59.japanese: あれって 常勤パンダさんの負担大きすぎるよね
59.english: Mr. Full-Time Panda is doing all the work.

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.japanese: パンダ君 やりきった顔してるな

62.speaker: POLAR BEAr
62.japanese: 常勤パンダさんやつれきった顔してるね

63.speaker: GRIZZLY
63.japanese: 常勤 やるじゃねえか
63.english: Not bad, Full-Time. Could you... leave me alone until I catch my breath? Well, then I think it's my turn. Please take a look at my domino setup.

65.speaker: LLAMA
65.japanese: この日のために２週間かけて並べました
65.english: It took me two weeks to prepare for this day.

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.japanese: 地味だけど すごいな

68.speaker: LLAMA
68.japanese: ありがとうございます

69.speaker: LLAMA
69.japanese: この辺が特に苦労したんですよ
69.english: This part right here was particularly hard.

70.speaker: LLAMA
70.japanese: ここに注目してください…

71.speaker: SASAKO
71.japanese: ラマさん 落ち込んでますね

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.japanese: すごかったよ 失敗しちゃったけど
72.english: It was amazing... though it failed.

73.speaker: LLAMA
73.japanese: しばらく ひとりにしてください
73.english: Could you leave me alone for a while.

75.speaker: LLAMA
75.japanese: ありがとうございます

76.speaker: GRIZZLY
76.japanese: うんちょっと待て シロクマよ
76.english: Hold it right there, Polar Bear!

77.speaker: GRIZZLY
77.japanese: さんざん待たせやがって
77.english: How long are you going to make me wait?!

78.speaker: GRIZZLY
78.japanese: オメエには 絶対負けられねえ

79.speaker: GRIZZLY
79.japanese: 俺のかくし芸 見やがれ

80.speaker: GRIZZLY
80.japanese: 俺のかくし芸 見やがれ

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: これはまた 荒々しいけど細やかなカードさばきだね
82.english: Once again, very violent, yet careful card handling. And then, in return, Polar Bear is...

83.speaker: PENGUIN
83.japanese: 華々しくも乱暴なマジック
83.english: Such rough and violent magic! Ta-da!

84.speaker: GRIZZLY
84.japanese: オラ いつもより多めに回すぜ
84.english: Take this! I'll spin a bigger one than usual!

88.speaker: GRIZzlY
88.japanese: はい ワンツー ワンツー
88.english: All right. One, two, one, two...

89.speaker: GRIZZLY
89.japanese: ワンツー ワンツー
89.english: One, two, one, two... One, two, one, two... One, two... Come on! What do you have next?!

92.speaker: POLAR BEAR
92.japanese: もう いいんじゃないかな 誰が勝ちでも
92.english: I think that's enough. Regardless of who wins, let's be good friends this year, too.

94.speaker: SASAKO
94.japanese: 皆さん おもち焼けましたよ
94.english: I've got grilled rice cakes, everyone! They look delicious!

95.speaker: POLAR BEAR
95.japanese: それじゃ あらためて…
95.english: Now, one more time... {\a6}Happy... Happy... New Year! {\a6}New Year... You got tired of the match, didn't you?

96.speaker: POLAR BEAR
96.japanese: まあ いいじゃない

98.speaker: PANDA
98.japanese: あれ シロクマ君は

99.speaker: PANDA
99.japanese: まだどこもお休みだな
99.english: Looks like everything is closed, still.

100.speaker: RINRIN
100.japanese: あっ パンダ君あけましておめでとう
100.english: Oh, Panda! Happy New Year! Oh, no! Wait, Panda!

101.speaker: PANDA
101.japanese: お正月早々リンリンに会っちゃったよ
101.english: The year's just begun, and I already bumped into Rin Rin...

102.speaker: PANDA
102.japanese: しろくまカフェ 早く営業しないかな
102.english: I wonder if Polar Bear's Café will open soon...

103.speaker: PANDA
103.japanese: もう帰ってゴロゴロしよう
103.english: I think I'll go home and laze around now.

105.speaker: MEI MEI
105.japanese: それでどうなったんですか

108.speaker: PANDA
108.japanese: あれ ペンギンさん

110.speaker: PANDA MAMA
110.english: Welcome home. Happy New Year, Panda.

112.speaker: PENGuin
112.japanese: カフェが休みだったから

113.japanese: ついでに パンダ君のとこに新年のあいさつに寄ったらさ…
113.english: so I thought I'd stop by your place for New Year's greetings and...

114.speaker: PANDA MAMA
114.japanese: ペンギンさんったらすぐ帰るだなんて言うからあがっていただいたのよ
114.english: Mr. Penguin said he was going to take off quickly, so I had him make himself at home.

116.speaker: PENGUIN
116.japanese: あっ おじいちゃん もう一本いきますか
116.english: Would you like another, Grandpa? Here you go, Grandpa.

118.speaker: GRANDPA
118.japanese: まあまあ ペンギンさんも一杯
118.english: You should have another, Mr. Penguin.

119.speaker: PENGUIN
119.english: Oh, no. I'll just pour for you.

122.speaker: GRANDPA
122.english: We have reached a mutual understanding.

126.speaker: PENGUIN
126.japanese: お母さん このお刺身最高ですね
126.english: Ma'am, this sashimi is fantastic! Help yourself, Mei Mei. It's delicious.

127.speaker: MEI MEI
127.japanese: ありがとうございます ペンギンさん
127.english: Thank you very much, Mr. Penguin. Sorry about that, Mr. Penguin. Not at all. I love other people's houses. Make sure you don't let go of the one you love, Mei Mei.

128.speaker: MEI MEI
128.japanese: えっ やっぱりそうですよね

129.speaker: PANDA
129.japanese: メイメイ ペンギンさんに恋の話聞いてもしかたないよ
129.english: There's no use in asking Mr. Penguin about love, Mei Mei...

130.speaker: MEI MEI
130.japanese: お兄ちゃんは黙ってて

131.speaker: MEI MEI
131.japanese: もっといろいろ教えてください

132.speaker: PENGUIN
132.japanese: 僕でよかったら 何でも聞いて
132.english: Sure, why not? Ask me anything. Mr. Penguin, you're really relaxed. Huh? Yeah. Something about being at your house is very relaxing. Really? Please, don't hold back. Thank you very much. Just one more, then.

133.speaker: PANDA MAMA
133.english: There you go. Grandpa, your cup is empty. Oh, so it is.

136.speaker: PENGUIN
136.japanese: あれ パンダ君 おかわりもらえる
136.english: Huh? Could we get another, Panda?

137.speaker: MEI MEI
137.japanese: お兄ちゃん ペンギンさんのおかわりえ
137.english: Get Mr. Penguin another, Brother! Huh?

139.speaker: MEI MEI
139.japanese: ホントお兄ちゃんてばペンギンさんと違って気が利かないわね
139.english: You're not thoughtful like Mr. Penguin. Wha...

140.speaker: PANDA
140.japanese: まいったなぁ 自分の家じゃない気分だよ
140.english: Jeez... It feels like it's not my house. Oh, I got in the bath before you, Panda.

141.speaker: PANDA
141.japanese: なに お風呂入っちゃったの
141.english: What? You got in the bath?

142.speaker: PENGUIN
142.japanese: 入っちゃったよ お母さんが入ってくれ入ってくれって言うからさ
142.english: I did. Your mom kept asking me to get in. Nothing beats a cold ice bath in the winter.

143.speaker: PANDA MAMA
143.japanese: ペンギンさん 温かいのが苦手なのに遠慮なさってるから
143.english: Mr. Penguin doesn't like hot water and was trying to hold back, so... I don't want to get into an ice bath.

144.speaker: pandA
144.japanese: もう強制的に帰ってもらおうよ
144.english: Let's forcefully ask him to leave.

145.speaker: PANDA MAMA
145.japanese: いいじゃないの お正月なんだから
145.english: Oh, it's fine. It's New Year's.

146.speaker: PENGUIN
146.japanese: お風呂 お先にいただきました

148.speaker: pengUIN
148.japanese: はい いいお風呂でした
148.english: Yes, the bath was great. Then are you going home now? Huh?

149.speaker: MEI MEI
149.japanese: 何言ってんの お兄ちゃん
149.english: What are you talking about, Brother?!

150.speaker: MEI MEI
150.japanese: ペンギンさんは帰らないの 飲み直すの
150.english: Mr. Penguin is not going home! He's going to drink more!

151.speaker: MEI MEI
151.japanese: おじいちゃんがとっておきのやつあけてくれるそうですよ ペンギンさん
151.english: Grandpa said he was opening an extra special bottle, Mr. Penguin.

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.japanese: 本当 そんな 悪いな

154.speaker: MEI MEI
154.english: No, he's not. It's a shame you're a penguin. Why not become a panda? Yeah! Maybe I should.

157.speaker: PANDA
157.english: I don't think so... Mr. Penguin, it's almost time for the last train.

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.japanese: 歩いて帰れるから大丈夫だよ
158.english: I can walk home, so it's fine.

160.speaker: PANDA MAMA
160.japanese: ペンギンさん お布団用意しときましたから
160.english: Mr. Penguin, I've prepared your futon. Wha?!

161.speaker: PENGUIN
161.japanese: いえ お母さん僕 もうそろそろ…
161.english: Oh, it's all right. I'll head out soon...

162.speaker: PANDA MAMA
162.japanese: 泊まってらして もう遅いし
162.english: Please stay the night. It's rather late.

163.speaker: MEI MEI
163.japanese: ペンギンさん 明日も遊んでね
163.english: Please play with me tomorrow, too, Mr. Penguin.

164.speaker: PENGUIN
164.japanese: ええっ そうですか

169.speaker: PANDA
169.english: I'll walk you to your house.

170.speaker: PENGUIN
170.english: But it's so late, so I'd feel bad.

171.speaker: PANDA
171.japanese: そうじゃなくて… 帰ってよ
171.english: That's not what I meant... Go home!

172.speaker: Mei Mei
172.japanese: お兄ちゃん どうしてペンギンさんにそんなひどいこと言うの
172.english: How can you say something so mean to Mr. Penguin?!

173.speaker: MEI MEI
173.japanese: ゆっくり休んでね ペンギンさん

175.speaker: PANDA MAMA
175.japanese: すみませんね お手伝いまでしていただいて
175.english: Sorry that we have you helping out.

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.japanese: いえ 一日お世話になったので
176.english: Not at all. You took care of me all day yesterday.

177.speaker: GRANDPA
177.japanese: ゆずこしょう どこだったかな

178.speaker: PENGUIN
178.japanese: ああ わかります わかります
178.english: Oh, I know. Here you go, Grandpa. Thanks.

179.speaker: PANDA
179.japanese: 僕より家に詳しくなってない
179.english: I think you know my house better than I do.

181.speaker: PAnDa
181.japanese: そろそろ家に帰ったほうがいいんじゃないかな
181.english: Maybe you should go home soon.

182.speaker: PENGUIN
182.japanese: 大丈夫 電話して新聞とめてもらったから
182.english: It's fine. I called and had them stop the newspaper.

183.speaker: penguin
183.japanese: 僕 枕が変わっても 何日でも寝られちゃうタイプなんだよね
183.english: I'm the type that can sleep for days, even when it's not my own pillow.

185.speaker: penguIN
185.japanese: お母さん あとでお掃除しちゃいますからね
185.english: I'll clean later, Ma'am. Thank you for all of your hard work.

186.speaker: PENGUIN
186.japanese: パンダ君 邪魔だよ
186.english: Panda, you're in the way. So annoying.

187.speaker: PANDA MAMA
187.japanese: あなたも ペンギンさんの爪の垢でも飲ませてもらったら
187.english: You should learn something from Mr. Penguin.

188.speaker: PENGUIN
188.japanese: そんな お母さん たいしたことありませんよ
188.english: Oh, it's nothing, really. Man, what a productive day.

189.speaker: PENGUIN
189.japanese: パンダ君 おやすみ

192.speaker: Polar BEAr
192.japanese: パンダ君 どうしたの
192.english: Panda? What's the matter? I have a small request...

194.speaker: PANDA
194.japanese: ペンギンさん 起きて

197.speaker: PENGUIN
197.japanese: あっ 太極拳 忘れてた

198.speaker: PENGUIN
198.japanese: おじいちゃんに謝ってこなきゃ
198.english: I should go apologize to Grandpa.

199.speaker: PANDA
199.japanese: それより ペンギンさん

200.speaker: PANDA
200.japanese: ちょっと外で話があるんだけど
200.english: I have something to tell you outside.

201.speaker: PENGUIN
201.japanese: 何 パンダ君どうしたの

202.speaker: PENGUIN
202.japanese: だいたい しろくまカフェはまだ休みでしょ
202.english: Polar Bear's Café should still be closed. See? Huh? It's open.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.japanese: あれ ５日までお休みじゃなかったの
204.english: Huh? I thought you were off until the fifth.

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.english: Well, whatever. Could I get a café mocha? Yes.

208.speaker: sASAKO
208.english: Here you go, Panda. Man, it doesn't feel like a new year until I've

209.japanese: 年が明けた気がしないね
209.english: had a mocha from here. What a relief. Thanks, Polar Bear. What?

210.japanese: あっ もしかして パンダ君にだけお年玉あげたの
210.english: Are you telling me you only gave Panda New Year's money? Well, something like that. Thank you, too, Miss Sasako.

211.speaker: saskO
211.japanese: お正月ってやることなくて
211.english: I had nothing to do for New Year's, and I thought I'd be able to come here and see everyone. You're right.

212.speaker: pEnguin
212.japanese: ほっとするなぁなんだかんだ言って
212.english: This is more relaxing. You always feel nervous at other people's houses.

213.speaker: penguin
213.japanese: やっぱり 僕がくつろげる場所はしろくまカフェだけだよ
213.english: The only place I can truly relax is Polar Bear's Café.

214.speaker: panda
214.japanese: シロクマ君 このカフェモカ下げちゃって
214.english: Please take away his mocha, Polar Bear!

217.speaker: PENGUIN
217.japanese: ちょっと シロクマ君

218.speaker: PANDA
218.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

220.speaker: PANDA
220.japanese: ペンギンさんの今年の目標は絶対に聞かせないでね
220.english: Please be sure to not tell me your goals this year. When you put it that way, I want to tell you.

221.speaker: PANDA
221.japanese: じゃあ カードの暗証番号教えて
221.english: Then could you give me your debit card pin?

223.speaker: SASAKO
223.japanese: ペンギンさん 終わってください

224.speaker: PENGUIN
224.japanese: 僕が 笹子さん いい加減役割把握して
224.english: Me? You need to learn everyone's roles, Miss Sasako.

225.speaker: PENGUIN
225.japanese: シロクマ君 終わろう

226.speaker: POLAR BEAR
226.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

227.japanese: 本当にうまいラーメン特集をお送りします
227.english: we will be a report on the best ramen shops.
